column1: # Rule ID    | Rule Name                   | Rule Description                                            | Enabled | Severity | Attack Type      | Params / Additional Info
1           | Cross-Site Scripting (XSS)   | Detects Cross-Site Scripting vulnerabilities in responses    | true    | High     | Injection         | -
2           | SQL Injection                | Detects SQL Injection vulnerabilities in user inputs        | true    | High     | Injection         | -
3           | Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) | Checks for CSRF vulnerabilities on API endpoints      | true    | Medium   | Authentication    | -
4           | Insecure Direct Object References (IDOR) | Detects IDOR vulnerabilities in API endpoints   | true    | High     | Authorization     | -
5           | Sensitive Data Exposure     | Detects the exposure of sensitive data (e.g., passwords, tokens) | true    | High     | Data Exposure     | -
6           | Missing HTTP Security Headers | Checks for missing security headers such as X-Content-Type-Options, X-Frame-Options, etc. | true    | Medium   | Configuration     | -
7           | Server Misconfiguration     | Identifies misconfigurations on the server (e.g., default pages, error messages) | true    | Medium   | Configuration     | -
8           | Path Traversal               | Detects path traversal vulnerabilities in URL parameters     | true    | High     | Injection         | -
9           | XML External Entity (XXE)    | Checks for XML External Entity injection vulnerabilities     | true    | High     | Injection         | -
10          | Remote Code Execution (RCE)  | Detects RCE vulnerabilities via unsafe API interactions       | true    | Critical | Code Execution    | -
11          | HTTP Response Splitting      | Checks for response splitting vulnerabilities in headers or body | true    | Medium   | Injection         | -
12          | Clickjacking                 | Detects the risk of clickjacking in API interfaces using improper headers | true    | Low      | Client-Side       | -
